section.title: Converting blobs to files
section.para: In the MMBase admin pages is a tool to start the conversion. You will need to configure your database first. Change the option 'database-supports-blob' to true:
Followed by these two lines of which the last line states the absolute path to which the blobs will be written.

The default configuration is that your binaries will be written to the data directory, which is configured in 'config/modules/mmbaseroot.xml'. But when you want your binaries in another location you can specify that with the last line, otherwise you can ommit that line.

section.title: Introducing 'DATETIME'
section.para: In MMBase 1.7 datetime were stored as 'LONG' or 'INTEGER' fields with 'guitype' 'eventtimes'. In 1.8 also 'DATETIME' is supported for database type. So if you have an existing installation, you may want to convert these fields.
It is simple to change the builder XML's, but the database will need a manual conversion.

section.title: PostgreSQL
section.para: Because the column cannot be dropped MMBase will issue a warning on it's startup: 13:36:55,810 8095kB WAR storage.implementation.database.DatabaseStorageManager - VERIFY: Column 'begin_' for builder 'categories' in Storage but not defined! This can safely be ignored, until the column can be dropped in some way. IIRC even newer version of postgresql cannot really drop the column, only hide it. In that case you can probably actually remove it by reimporting a database dump.
